name: Sofia Angels Ventures
description: Sofia Angels Ventures is a EUR 13 million co-investment venture capital fund backed by the European Investment Fund to co-invest on deal-by-deal basis alongside private co-investors (angels, family offices, funds and other private institutions). Focus on tech startups at the early stage of development. Ticket size of EUR 200k – EUR 500k for first investment and up-to EUR 1.0m for follow-on investments. The management team consists of professionals with considerable financial, entrepreneurial and operating experience, who themselves are angel investors. The management team has invested its own capital in the fund. Strong network of angel investors creates a unique advantage in deal sourcing.
investmentAreas: Fintech, Greentech, Agritech, Medtech, HRtech, AI, Sustainability

name: Zaz Ventures
description: Zaz Ventures has helped deeptech innovators to raise 1.1Bn Euros of EC funding since 2014. We provide fundraising advisory services (identifying funding instruments, preparing hybrid funding application combining grant and equity) across a variety of domains (ICT, Robotics, Security, Space, Transportation, Manufacturing, Nanomaterials, Health, Agri-Food, Energy, Raw Materials, Environment). We have offices in Brussels, London, Paris, Stans, Krakow and Madrid. All our projects are carried out on a no-win-no-pay basis. This means that we only invoice our services when (and if) the client receives public funding. This formula is particularly attractive for very competitive schemes where the average success rate is currently below 5%, such as the EIC Accelerator.
investmentAreas: Consulting, Finance, Call Monitoring, Fundraising
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: Shelly Group
description: Leading IoT company with main focus on producing high-class smart home devices. Shelly is a company that specializes in smart home and facility automation. They offer highly customizable solutions for both home buildings and business facilities, including smart lighting and appliance control.
investmentAreas: Mobile messaging, Mobile billing, Digital media, Marketing, IoT
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: Eleven Ventures
description: Eleven is one of the leading early-stage VCs in Southeast Europe, investing in startups since 2012. With 170+ collective investments over 12 years, Eleven’s team has been instrumental in catalyzing the regional startup ecosystem. Eleven supports tech companies in four priority verticals - Fintech, Healthcare, Future of Work, and Sustainable Food. Some of the startups that Eleven has backed include Payhawk, Quantive, Dronamics, SMSBump, and Native Teams.
investmentAreas: Fintech, Healthcare, Sustainable Food, Future of Work

name: Innovation Capital
description: EUR 21.1 million Pre-Seed and Seed Venture Fund with Acceleration program. Venture capital fund focused on Pre-Seed (EUR 25,000-50,000) and Seed (up to EUR 1,000,000) funding rounds. Sector agnostic with preference for scaleable and innovative business models.
investmentAreas: Robotics, AI, Enterprise Software, FoodTech, Transport, Logistics, Automotive

name: LAUNCHub Ventures
description: LAUNCHub Ventures is a leading early-stage venture capital fund focusing on technology startups in Central and Southeastern Europe (SEE & CEE), and beyond, with investments ranging from €300K to €2M initially, and up to €4M in subsequent rounds. They support ambitious founders from the region, offering not just funding but also extensive assistance to accelerate growth. Their 'Series A academy' program has successfully guided many startups to milestones and follow-up funding. Established in 2012, LAUNCHub Ventures has significantly contributed to the CEE startup ecosystem and attracted investments from major VC firms in Europe and the US.
investmentAreas: Future of Work, Productivity, Blockchain, EV Mobility, AI, Hardware, Fintech, Software, Marketplaces, SaaS, Gaming, Travel Tech

name: Vitosha Venture Partners
description: €20m acceleration, seed, and post-seed fund based in Sofia, Bulgaria. Vitosha Venture Partners specializes in early-stage and growth-stage investments ranging from EUR 25,000 to EUR 1,000,000, specifically targeting companies based in or connected to Bulgaria. They seek out resourceful founders with impactful ideas and a strong execution strategy. Leveraging their extensive investment experience, global network, and market access, Vitosha Venture Partners is dedicated to empowering entrepreneurs and nurturing them into industry leaders.
investmentAreas: Marketplace, Ecommerce, SaaS, ML, AI

name: Impetus Capital
description: "Impetus Capital is an early-stage venture capital fund specializing in backing strong founding teams focused on building rapidly growing tech companies poised for global expansion. They target companies in the early stage with post-traction, typically investing initial tickets ranging from EUR 0.3m to 0.5m. Impetus Capital is committed to long-term support, particularly for companies that have demonstrated double-digit growth potential. With a strategic focus on Central and Eastern Europe (CEE), Impetus Capital prioritizes investments in CEE-based companies, with a preference for those with a Bulgarian angle. Their investment approach aims to foster growth and innovation within the region's tech ecosystem while facilitating global scalability for their portfolio companies."
investmentAreas: SaaS, Biotech, Life Sciences, InsurTech, Machine Learning

name: New Vision 3
description: New Vision 3 is a venture capital fund specializing in early-stage investments in tech-enabled companies driving innovation. Founded and managed by a seasoned team with a decade-long track record in startup and tech investments, the fund aims to become the preferred partner for visionary entrepreneurs contributing to the growth of the Bulgarian and regional economies. They are committed to supporting, commercializing, and globalizing the regional tech ecosystem, particularly in sectors such as FinTech, AI, Blockchain, and the Shared Economy. New Vision 3 Fund is co-financed by the European Structural and Investment Funds under the Operational Programme for Innovation and Competitiveness 2014-2020, managed by the Fund of Funds in Bulgaria, underscoring their commitment to fostering innovation and competitiveness in the region.
investmentAreas: "FinTech & Blockchain Artificial Intelligence Shared Economy & Platforms IoT & Big Data"

name: Neo Ventures
description: Neo Ventures is a deep tech fund that invests in the builders of digital infrastructure for smart cities, outpatient healthcare, and space missions. For nearly a decade, they have supported artificial intelligence and machine learning technology startups in developing and deploying reliable, scalable data solutions that serve billions today. Neo Ventures provides comprehensive support to founders, including business planning, scaling operations, follow-on investments, maximizing opportunities, and navigating challenging situations.
investmentAreas: Aerospace, Cyber Security, Health Care, Security

name: Morningside Hill Capital Management
description: In November 2019 Morningside Hill launched its latest venture capital fund, which is focused on providing growth capital to Bulgarian startup companies. The fund has EUR 38.5 million under management to be invested in equity (or equivalent) minority positions in 25 to 30 companies. The VC fund comprises public funds of EUR 33.3 million provided by the Fund Manager of Financial Instruments in Bulgaria EAD under the operational programme “Innovation and Competitiveness” co-financed by the European Structural and Investment Funds for the 2014-2020 programming period. The typical investment holding period is 5-10 years, while exit opportunities will be evaluated ad hoc.
investmentAreas: HRTech, Semiconductors, AgTech, Alternative Proteins

name: HR Capital
description: Digital transformation is rapidly reshaping global industries such as healthcare, logistics, and agriculture, extending its reach even to remote regions. The democratization of capital facilitated by Covid-19 has opened up global investment opportunities for companies worldwide, from Nigeria to Romania. Concurrently, there has been a significant rise in online commerce, facilitating cross-border trade and increasing product diversity. With a solid foundation in traditional business and the establishment of a leading digital media group, the firm is highly regarded as a partner for innovative companies in Bulgaria and beyond. They strategically diversify investments between individual companies and funds to mitigate risks effectively. Notable investments include eBag in groceries ecommerce, BIODIT in biometric security, and Superdoc & Healee in telemedicine, highlighting their commitment to leveraging expertise and market access for substantial business growth.
investmentAreas: healthcare, hospitality, logistics, agriculture

name: Neo Gravity
description: Operating within the professional investing market, the firm participates in early-stage and mature businesses throughout Southeastern Europe. It strives to offer rapid decision-making on investment opportunities and provides comprehensive support services customized to each company's specific needs. Key sectors of focus include Food & Beverages, Pet Care, Mobility, and B2B2C Tech.
investmentAreas: Food & Beverages, Pet Care, Mobility, and B2B2C Tech.

name: AlfaStar Ventures
description: AlfaStar Capital is an Evergreen venture capital fund, focused on finding and supporting the AlfaStars - exceptional founders of early-stage start-ups and disrupting innovators, taking on the challenge to reshape our future. With this purpose in mind, we created AlfaStar Capital – an open-ended investment opportunity. The Fund backs early-stage ventures, focused on breakthrough innovation ideas, enabled by cutting-edge technologies like AI, Machine & Deep Learning, Big Data, Cloud, Metaverse, Blockchain.
investmentAreas: AgTech, CleanTech, FinTech, GreenTech, Industrial Automation, Robotics, Wealth Management, Wellness

name: StartItSmart
description: Start It Smart is an entrepreneurship organization created to spread and develop the entrepreneurial way of thinking. Start It Smart is an entrepreneurship organization created to spread and develop the entrepreneurial way of thinking, while supporting young people to start their own business. Start It Smart is an entrepreneurship organization founded in 2009 by five fellow students at the Sofia University “St. Kliment Ohridski”.
investmentAreas: Social Entrepreneurship, Social Media, Social Media Marketing

name: InvestHorizon
description: Designed to increase investments made in Innovative European SMEs through Investment Readiness development and Investor sensitization. InvestHorizon is a programme designed to boost investments made in Innovative European SMEs through Investment Readiness development and Investor sensitisation. The Invest Horizon programs were very helpful to step up our game in the investment field.
investmentAreas: Financial Services, Capital Markets, Investment, Innovation

name: Innovation Capital
description: €21.1 million Pre-Seed and Seed Venture Fund with Acceleration program / Sector-agnostic / Geographic preference: Eastern Europe. Venture capital fund focused on Pre-Seed (EUR 25,000-50,000) and Seed (up to EUR 1,000,000) funding rounds. We are sector agnostic with preference for scaleable and innovative business models.
investmentAreas: Venture Capital, Private Equity Principals, Funding, Innovative

name: Vitosha Venture Partners
description: Specializing in acceleration, seed, and post-seed investments. We support innovative startups with funding, strategic guidance, and access to a robust network. At Vitosha Ventures, we are dedicated to fostering entrepreneurship and driving growth in the European startup ecosystem.
investmentAreas: Entrepreneurshi, Venture Capital, Private Equity Principals, Funding

name: AE Ventures
description: AE Ventures is a for-profit company. Investment company providing initial funding, acceleration, and advisory support to blockchain projects. AE Ventures is an investment company providing initial funding, acceleration and advisory support to blockchain projects. The company also runs æternity Starfleet - a full-service global acceleration program for seed-stage startups utilizing blockchain.
investmentAreas: Blockchain, Applications, Investment, Accelerator

name: Beyond
description: Beyond is a pre-acceleratorr implemented by JA Bulgaria and its spin-off company The Edge R&BD. The program targets young entrepreneurs, scientists along with young professionals that want to work on creating and developing lean technology startups. Beyond applies the open innovation model, meaning the creation of multidisciplinary teams of people with different backgrounds and competences that work in the same teams with the end goal of creating an MVP.
investmentAreas: Entrepreneurship, Education, Medicine, Innovations
